observation: Eco Material Technologies | ecomaterial.com  Search About Leadership Eco Material in the News ESG Report Safety Services CCP Management CFB Ash Management Disposed Ash Harvesting for Beneficial Use Engineering Services Gypsum Processing & Management Utility Services Products & Technologies Ammonia Slip Mitigation Engineered Materials Fly Ash Green Cement Highly Reactive Pozzolans Kirkland Natural Pozzolan Manufacturing Materials RestoreAir ® Road Construction Materials Reference Contact Careers "Unlikely duo: I-35 & green cement" – Austin Daily Click here to learn more Eco Material Technologies Eco Material Technologies is North America’s leading producer Featured Technologies Eco Material has reengineered pozzolanic cement to make it react faster—matching the one-day performance of portland cement. PozzoSlag Learn more » Harvesting and Beneficiation As coal plant retirements continue to reduce the availability of current-production fly ash, harvesting of previously disposed ash becomes increasingly important to ensure a ready supply of pozzolanic material for use in the production of concrete. In such instances, Eco Material Technologies can perform testing, reclamation, and marketing of coal ash to ensure it meets all regulatory and commercial requirements. ES Efficient Carbon Offloading™ (ECO) System Eco Material offers a range of beneficiation technologies to ensure that harvested coal ash conforms to ASTM and customer standards. One such technology is our ES Efficient Carbon Offloading™ (ECO) System approach, which provides the flexibility to process a wide range of carbon (LOI) content and fineness found in the landfill and keeps capital and processing costs at a minimum when compared to our competitors. Ash before after Our Operations Eco Material’s diverse operations include facilities that produce sustainable cement alternatives from fly ash, bottom ash, and harvested ash. As these operations are expanded, Eco Material expects to increase its North American leadership position in zero- and near-zero-carbon products by doubling the volumes of these materials sold into the North American concrete market by 2030. Jewett, Texas For over a decade, Eco Material’s Jewett, Texas, facility has produced near-zero-carbon products that can replace 50-100% of the cement required to produce high-performance concrete. To date, the plant has produced over one million tons for use in roads, dams, bridges, and other infrastructure. Central Texas Our bottom ash grinding facility in central Texas—the first of its kind in the U.S.—processes bottom ash for sale into concrete markets. Production and sale of these materials are helping to extend supplies of concrete-grade ash in regional markets. Danville, Pennsylvania Our facility in Danville, Pennsylvania—in operation since 2020—harvests coal ash from a nearby landfill and processes it to specification-grade product. Testing and analysis of this material show it to be consistently higher quality than current-generation ash across a range of performance criteria. LEARN MORE ABOUT OUR PRODUCTS ► SEE WHAT ECO MATERIAL CAN OFFER ► Locations FIND A REPRESENTATIVE NEAR YOU ► GET THE RESOURCES Scroll Home Terms of Use Privacy Notice Do Not Sell My Personal Information Cookie Settings CAA and TCR Information Cookie Policy This website uses cookies to enhance user experience and to analyze performance and traffic on our website. Manage My Cookie Preferences Accept All Cookies In short: Cookie Preferences: Strictly Necessary Cookies Always Active These cookies are necessary for the website to function and cannot be switched off. They are usually only set in response to actions you perform. You can set your browser to block or alert you about these cookies, but if you choose to do so, some parts of the site may not work properly. Tracking Cookies Enabled Under the California Consumer Privacy Act, you have the right to opt-out of the sale of your personal information to third parties. These tracking cookies collect information for analytics. You may exercise your right to opt out of the sale of personal information by using this toggle switch.

thought: The search results indicate that there is a low trust score associated with a similar domain ecomaterial.co, but that is not the same domain as ecomaterial.com. There is no specific information suggesting that ecomaterial.com is a scam. Since this is a common issue where scam websites may have similar-sounding names to legitimate ones, I will further confirm the credibility of ecomaterial.com by checking for any scam reports or discussions on social media or forums.

There are no results from the Twitter search regarding ecomaterial.com being a scam. This could indicate that there is no widespread reporting or discussion of the site as a scam on this platform. To ensure a thorough analysis, I should also check on other social platforms, such as Reddit, to see if there are any discussions or reports of scams related to ecomaterial.com.

There are no results from the Reddit search regarding ecomaterial.com being a scam. At this point, there is no substantial evidence from the WHOIS information, website text content, or social media searches to suggest that ecomaterial.com is a scam website. The lack of negative reports or scam accusations on both Twitter and Reddit, along with the longevity of the domain and the nature of the business (which appears to be eco-friendly construction materials), suggests that the website is likely legitimate. I now know the final answer. Based on the available evidence, ecomaterial.com does not appear to be a scam website.

observation.reason: The website appears to be a legitimate business dealing with eco-friendly construction materials with no significant negative indicators such as unrealistic claims targeting psychological weaknesses or suspicious contact information. The domain has been active since 2009 and there are no scam reports on social media or forums.
